briefdescription.para: List of clean built-in node models.
List of usable node models.

detaileddescription.para: This list is cleared and repopulated upon application startup and calls to ResetKernel. It contains copies of the built-in models, models registered from extension modules, and models created by calls to CopyModel(). The elements of this list also keep the user-modified defaults.

briefdescription.para: List of built-in clean connection models.
The list of usable connection models.

detaileddescription.para: The first dimension keeps one entry per thread, the second dimension has the actual models. This list is cleared and repopulated upon application startup and calls to ResetKernel. The inner list contains copies of the built-in models, models registered from extension modules, and models created by calls to CopyModel(). The elements of the list also keep the user-modified defaults.

briefdescription.para: Dictionary of all node models.
Dictionary of all synapse models.
Placeholders for remote nodes, one per thread.
True if any model defaults have been modified.
Prepare manager for operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, the manager should be completely initialized and "ready for action".

simplesect.para: Initialization of any given manager may depend on other managers having been initialized before. KernelManager::initialize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order.

briefdescription.para: Take down manager after operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, all dynamic data structures created by the manager shall be deallocated and containers emptied. Plain variables need not be reset.

simplesect.para: Finalization of any given manager may depend on other managers not having been finalized yet. KernelManager::finalize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order, i.e., the opposite order of initialize() calls.

briefdescription.para: Change the number of threads.

detaileddescription.para: Many data structures within the different managers depend on the number of threads. This function is called on each manager upon a change of that number and allows the manager to re-allocate data structures accordingly.

briefdescription.para: Resize the structures for the Connector objects if necessary.

detaileddescription.para: Functor to compare Models by their name.

This function should be called after number of threads, min_delay, max_delay, and time representation have been changed in the scheduler. The TimeConverter is used to convert times from the old to the new representation. It is also forwarding the calibration request to all ConnectorModel objects.

briefdescription.para: Return a proxynode configured for thread tid and the given node_id.
Return pointer to protoype for given synapse id.

xrefdescription.para: : make the return type const, after the increment of num_connections and the min_ and max_delay setting in ConnectorBase was moved out to the ConnectionManager

briefdescription.para: Register a node-model prototype.

detaileddescription.para:
This function must be called exactly once for each model class to make it known in the simulator. The natural place for a call to this function is in a *module.cpp file.
name
of the new node model.
deprecation_info
If non-empty string, deprecation warning will be issued for model with this info to user.
ID of the new model object.
register_prototype_connection

briefdescription.para: Copy an existing model and register it as a new model.

detaileddescription.para:
This function allows users to create their own, cloned models.
old_name
name of existing model.
new_name
name of new model.
params
default parameters of new model.
model ID of new Model object.
copy_node_model_, copy_connection_model_

briefdescription.para: Set the default parameters of a model.

simplesect.para: true if the operation succeeded, else false

briefdescription.para: Register a synape model with a custom Connector model and without any common properties.

detaileddescription.para: "hpc synapses" use TargetIdentifierIndex for ConnectionT and store the target neuron in form of a 2 Byte index instead of an 8 Byte pointer. This limits the number of thread local neurons to 65,536. No support for different receptor types. Otherwise identical to non-hpc version.
When called, this function should be specialised by a class template, e.g. bernoulli_synapse< targetidentifierT >

parameterdescription.para: The name under which the ConnectorModel will be registered.

briefdescription.para: Register a synape with default Connector and without any common properties.

simplesect.para: The model ID for a Model with a given name

parameterdescription.para: if the model is not available

simplesect.para: The Model registered with the given model ID
The numeric ID of a given synapse model

parameterdescription.para: if the model is not available

briefdescription.para: Checks, whether synapse type requires symmetric connections.
Checks, whether synapse type requires Clopath archiving.
Checks, whether synapse type requires Urbanczik archiving.
Asserts validity of synapse index, otherwise throws exception.
Print out the memory information for each node model.
Copy an existing node model and register it as a new model.

simplesect.para: model ID of new Model object.

simplesect.para: model ID of new Model object.
